page.title: 02Stratton School
page.content: Stratton was founded in 1951. It was a Grammar School and you had to pass an examination to get in. The building was completed in 1955 and they used Italian craftsmen to lay the marble effect floors. In 1951, there were approximately 600 pupils in the school. By 1959, there were 1100 pupils. All the teachers had to wear a gown. The pupils wore blazers, caps or berets; senior pupils had different coloured blazers and arm-bands. There was an assembly every day except Mondays (dinner money collection day). The first formers sat on benches on the stage. At dinner time everyone sat at their own table. One person would get the dinners and another would serve it out. When the dinner was finished, someone else would fetch dessert.
